pulltitle: Rename to PyBrowserID, force people to specify audiences up-front
pullsbody: @ametaireau, here are the two changes we discussed yesterday - renaming to PyBrowserID in line with the new branding, and passing a list of audience patterns into the verifier.
pull_repo_desc: python client library for the Verified Email Protocol (aka "BrowserID")

pullsbody: Hey, here are some typo I fixed while reading the code (+Flake8)
pull_repo_desc: python client library for the Verified Email Protocol (aka "BrowserID")

pulltitle: Using get_assertion_info instead of decode_json_bytes to read audience
pullsbody: Using decode_json_bytes here seemed to be struggling (tested with a repoze.who.plugins.browserid setup) to read the assertion. As far as I can tell, this utility should provide the same behaviour and remedies the issue for me.
pull_repo_desc: python client library for the Verified Email Protocol (aka "BrowserID")
pull_commit_message: Use `vep.utils.get_assertion_info` to retrieve intended audience instead of `vep.utils.decode_json_bytes` as it seems to be more stable.

pulltitle: Using get_assertion_info instead of decode_json_bytes to read audience

pull_repo_desc: python client library for the Verified Email Protocol (aka "BrowserID")
